description:
The Grafana dashboard, developed by Pironman, is a much more effective and attractive alternative to the interface displayed by the "pm_dashboard" Python-based application, which instantly transfers sensor data to influxDB.

Developed by FXerkan - https://github.com/fxerkan/pironman_grafana_dashboard

panels.description: Please do not forget to first select the value/option in the "RGB Style" variable from the variables bar at the top to use the "Change" button.

actions.confirmation: Are you sure want to change RGB Style to "${prm_rgb_style}"
actions.title: Set RGB Style --> "${prm_rgb_style}"

panels.description:
Please do not forget to first select the value/option in the "OLED Disk" variable from the variables bar at the top to use the "Change" button.

Sets which Disc's capacity and usage information will be displayed on the OLED screen.

actions.confirmation: Are you sure want to change OLED Disk to "${prm_oled_disk}"
actions.title: Set OLED Disk --> "${prm_oled_disk}"

panels.description:

Sets which Network Interface information will be displayed on the OLED screen.

actions.title: Set OLED Network Interface --> "${prm_oled_network}"

actions.title: Set GPIO Fan Mode --> "${prm_gpio_fan_mode:key}"

panels.title: GPIO Fan Mode

targets.query: SELECT moving_average(mean("network_download_speed"), 10) * -1 FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

SELECT 
       last("cpu_count") as "# CPU Cores" ,
       median("cpu_freq") as "CPU Frequency", 
       last("cpu_freq_min") as "CPU Frequency - Min",
       last("cpu_freq_max") as "CPU Frequency - Max"
FROM "history" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
ORDER BY time DESC 
LIMIT 1
SELECT moving_average(mean("cpu_0_percent"), 10) FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

SELECT 
       last("memory_percent") as "Memory %" ,
       median("memory_used") /1024/1024 as "Used Memory (GB)", 
       last("memory_available") /1024/1024 as "Available Memory (GB)",
       last("memory_total") /1024/1024 as "Total Memory (GB)"
FROM "history" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
ORDER BY time DESC 
LIMIT 1
SELECT moving_average(mean("cpu_0_percent"), 10) FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

SELECT 
      last("network_type") as "Network Type(s)" ,
       last("mac_wlan0") as "WiFi MAC", 
       last("ip_wlan0") as "WiFi IP", 
       last("mac_end0") as "Ethernet MAC",
       last("ip_end0") as "Ethernet IP",
       last("mac_docker0")  as "Docker MAC",
       last("ip_docker0")  as "Docker IP",
       last("mac_lxcbr0")  as "Lxcbr MAC",
       last("ip_lxcbr0")  as "Lxcbr IP",
       last("mac_tailscale0")  as "Tailscale MAC",
       last("ip_tailscale0")  as "Tailscale IP"
FROM "history" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
ORDER BY time DESC 
LIMIT 1
SELECT moving_average(mean("network_download_speed"), 10) * -1 FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT moving_average(mean("cpu_0_percent"), 10) FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT moving_average(mean("cpu_0_percent"), 10) FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)
SELECT moving_average(mean("cpu_0_percent"), 10) FROM "history" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval)

list.label: RGB Style
list.name: prm_rgb_style
list.query: none, solid, breathing, flow, flow_reverse, rainbow, rainbow_reverse, hue_cycle

list.description: only available if RGB Style = Solid
list.label: RGB Color
list.name: prm_rgb_color

list.description:
OLED Sleep Timeout duration miliseconds.
Options : 0 = never sleep/always on,
60 = 1 minute later
list.label: OLEP Sleep
list.name: prm_oled_sleep_timeout

list.description: Sets which Disc's capacity and usage information will be displayed on the OLED screen.
list.label: OLED Disk
list.name: prm_oled_disk

list.description: Sets which Network Interface information will be displayed on the OLED screen.
list.label: OLED Network
list.name: prm_oled_network

list.description:
Determines the operating frequency and noise level of the GPIO Fan. Options = Quite : 4,
Balanced : 3,
Cool : 2,
Performance : 1,
Always_on : 0
list.label: GPIO Fan Mode
list.name: prm_gpio_fan_mode

list.description: Select the Log File name that you need to see in the "Logs Detail" panel like "data_logger", "vibration_switch", "database", "ws2812" etc.
list.label: Logs File
list.name: prm_logs

title: Pironman 5 Dashboard (Business)
